Class: WebSocket

WebSocket

WebSocket provides a bidirectional communication channel. Application developers should use WebSocketFactory#createWebSocket() function to create an instance of WebSocket.

new WebSocket(url, protocols)

Creates and immedately connects a new WebSocket instance.. If the url is not valid, the constructor will throw a SyntaxError. If the port is blocked by the browser or if a secure connection is attemped from a non-secure origin, the constructor will throw a SecurityException. If any protocol value is invalid or if a protocol appears in the Array more than once, the constructor will throw a SyntaxError. Application developers should use WebSocketFactory.createWebSocket function to create an instance of WebSocket.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
url String
protocols String | Array.<String>
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11829
See:
  • WebSocketFactory#createWebSocket See WebSocketFactory.

Members

binaryType :String

Type of binary data for message events. Valid values are "blob", "arraybuffer" and "bytebuffer". Blob and ByteBuffer will work on any supported browser. ArrayBuffer is only an allowable value on browsers that support the Typed Array Specification . If this property is set to an invalid type, a SyntaxError will be thrown. NOTE: On older platforms where setter cannot be defined, the value is checked onmessage is fired. If set to an invalid value, the error event is fired.
Type:
  • String
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11855

<readonly> bufferedAmount :Number

(Read only) Number of bytes that are queued to send but not yet written to the network.
Type:
  • Number
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11847

<readonly> connectTimeout :Number(Integer)

(Read only) Connect timeout in milliseconds. The timeout will expire if there is no exchange of packets(for example, 100% packet loss) while establishing the connection. A timeout value of zero indicates no timeout.
Type:
  • Number(Integer)

(Read only) Protocol name selected by the WebSocket server during the connection handshake.
Type:
  • String
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11849

<readonly> readyState :Number

(Read only) State of the connection. It can be one of the following constants -

CONNECTING(0): The connection is not yet open.
OPEN(1): The connection is open and ready to communicate.
CLOSING(2): The connection is in the process of closing.
CLOSED(3): The connection is closed or couldn't be opened.
Type:
  • Number
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11845

<readonly> url :String

(Read only) WebSocket end-point or location.
Type:
  • String
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11853

Methods

close(code, reason) → {void}

Disconnects the WebSocket. If code is not an integer equal to 1000 or in the range 3000..4999, close() will throw an InvalidAccessError. The reason string must be at most 123 bytes when UTF-8 encoded. If the reason string is too long, close() will throw a SyntaxError.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
code Number (Optional) A numeric value indicating close code.
reason String (Optional) A human readable string indicating why the client is closing the WebSocket
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11831
Returns:
Type
void

getChallengeHandler() → {ChallengeHandler}

Gets the ChallengeHandler that is used during authentication both at the connect-time as well as at subsequent revalidation-time that occurs at regular intervals.
Source:

getRedirectPolicy() → {HttpRedirectPolicy}

Gets the default HTTP redirect policy used in a clustered environment for this connection. Default redirect policy is HttpRedirectPolicy.ALWAYS.
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11839
Returns:
Type
HttpRedirectPolicy

send(data) → {void}

Sends a WebSocket message containing the given payload. Can be called with a String, Blob, ArrayBuffer or ByteBuffer. When send() is called with a String, a text WebSocket message is sent. When send() is called with a Blob, ArrayBuffer or ByteBuffer, a binary WebSocket message is sent. If send() is called with other data types an invalid type Error will be thrown. If send() is called while the WebSocket is in the CONNECTING state, an InvalidStateError will be thrown.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
data String | Blob | ArrayBuffer | ByteBuffer message payload
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11833
Returns:
Type
void

Events

close

Event fired when the WebSocket connection closes. See CloseEvent.
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11875

error

Event fired when the WebSocket closes uncleanly.
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11873

message

Event fired when a WebSocket message arrives. The data property of the MessageEvent will be a String when the WebSocket message is a WebSocket text message. It will be the type specified by binaryType if the message is a WebSocket binary message.
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11869

open

Event fired when the WebSocket connection opens.
Source:
  • WebSocket-debug.js, line 11871
